author: Tevo
title: PCDiscord - Bot to create channels
description: It takes resources to maintain and moderate a large Discord channel

assessments.note: This is perhaps my only query with this proposal, does it address the challenge? Seems more like an administration challenge proposal than onboarding given onboarding can be widely defined.
assessments.reply: Project Catalyst Discord channel is onboarding people into smaller groups and gives a safe place to discuss proposals outside the ideascale and offical telegram

assessments.note: The problem and the solution are clear and objective. The proposal is within the scope of the challenge and can assist in the administration of the Catalyst server on Discord. This proposal has a considerable impact in relation to her budget, which I see as a great cost-benefit ratio, as Catalyst's Discord is being the most engaged tool in the community and needs to be improved in order to maintain the onboarding capacity. It is a priority for our community.

Once the server gets extremely big and people with many languages join, bots might help to organize the discord channels if properly programmed. Since the activity on the server is still relatively low at the moment, it needs to be determined whether this is neccessary already.

The proposal is very interesting, because it uses something that already exists (Cardano's discord channel) and intends to improve it, with the aim of benefiting communication between members of the community. I don't think, however, that this idea will attract new people to Cardano (one of the goals of this challenge), but rather to make members more engaged and increase the chances of staying in the community. So, in the end, it remains very positive, in my view.

The idea of removing the responsibility of creating channels from admins and sharing it with the community is good and aligned to community-governance ideal. Although, I'm not sure that this alone would increase the number of proposal related channels. I guess that most proposers wouldn't know about this feature upfront, and will have to ask someone, just how they ping admins today to ask for a channel. There are also possibilities of spamming with multiple channels, and this could be critical because the Discord server already has many different channels.
Simple plan that could add some nice functionality to help out moderators.
I do feel the team will be able to deliver on this proposal and they are not asking for excessive budget. The plan is quite straightforward and therefore seems valid.

The proposers are moderators on the Discord Catalyst server, are already involved with the Catalyst community and participated in Swarm Sessions. The team is involved in the development of Landing Page and other improvement initiatives in Catalyst. The team has skills to execute the proposal.

The described plan is simple and sufficient due to the low complexity of the proposal. On the Miro board there is more information about the rationale of the proposal and the plan. There is a reasonable, week-long timeline.


There are details on budget allocation on the Miro board and the hours needed to carry out the different stages of development.

The proposers seem to have a lot of experience with the structure of the Discord, however not with programming (at least it is not mentioned under relevant experience). A realistic time budget is presented.

Regarding the team that proposes this project, in my opinion, it is very solid and well prepared to successfully carry out the idea. They are people from different areas, such as developers, engineers, designers ... it seems to me that all fronts of the project will be well underway with such a diverse team. The only observation I would make is that it is always valid to show some examples of work done previously by those involved.
assessments.reply: We are not a full team, but I do have capability to put the team together, I think they read the required roles as a team

assessments.note: Since the proposer is an experienced Discord channel admin, I see that this proposal is completely feasible in the defined time frame. Also, each step is clearly detailed. Although, the proposal states that this is a mini proposal that would cost 3000 ADA, but is asks for 500, but maybe it's a typo. Also, I didn't understand the roles that were mentioned in the text. It seems like a general text that would fit other mini proposals, but it could be clearer. Obs.: This assessment is very similar to the one in Bot to Assign Roles, because the proposal text is almost the same as well.

Hard to say as the proposers are asking for minimal funds but need to find people to do it. Unsure whether they will. Not clear what the funds are for. Is this to pay server costs or for peoples time?

The information provided is sufficient. The proposal itself is not overly complex or requiring a huge investment of time. My only concern is whether onboarding challenge is correctly explained and its only a minor concern.

There is clarity in the problem, solution and alignment of the proposal with the challenge.

There are details on the number of hours required for the development of each stage of development, the budget is reasonable and there are details on the allocation of resources according to the hourly load x hourly payment.

There is a simple one-week timeline. There are objective KPIs.

As the proposal involves low complexity, the audit is relatively simple and there are sufficient elements to carry out such an audit.
The proposal all in all is detailed enough to be able to be evaluated, however some important details are missing, like details on the functionalities of the bot.
assessments.reply: The functionalities are clearly brought out, but I guess he means how its used_ what could be find on Miro board, but I get it not easy to find it there

assessments.note: There is attached a picture of the miro application with a lot of detail about the project, which shows that the team has been very clear about everything that will be done, all the technical details and so on. However, this picture is a little confusing and difficult to understand for outsiders, I think it is always more interesting to make a timeline of the time when we can understand what will be done and when. As it is a small proposal, they measured the steps in hours, which is very interesting, because it shows total planning in relation to what should be followed.

Since this project is very simple, it would be easy to audit and confirm that it has been performed according to the plan, specially because it would be an open source development. Also, KPI is clearly stated and it is sufficient to evaluate the proposal impact. Although, risk of spamming was not accounted for and should be assessed. Obs.: This assessment is very similar to the one in Bot to Assign Roles, because the proposal text is almost the same as well.
Main issue is who is doing it? if the proposers aren't doing it, then what is the plan to organise the people who will?

solution: A bot what can create a channel in a correct place and give the channel full access to the creator
experience: Discord Moderator, Passionate about the project, Project Manager
